messages.title: A GENERAL ELECTION IS ON ITS WAY
messages.content: Your Calder Valley Labour candidate is Josh Fenton-Glynn

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The NHS has been there for my family in difficult times, but it’s been starved of money, and hurt by years of creeping privatisation.
We need more jobs that are not increasingly casual, precarious work that undermines our dignity, and makes our lives uncertain.
Anyone hit by the floods knows the importance of this. We only have one planet, and we have to protect it. My daughter’s generation is relying on us.
Some of the trains on the Calder Valley line are as old as I am. We need long-term planning for northern railways.
We need proper regional infrastructure development in Calderdale and in Yorkshire. We have a real opportunity to create 'green' jobs and jobs in high-tech manufacturing.

issues.environment: Climate change is a key issue, with a focus on the importance of protecting the planet.
issues.health: The NHS has been there for my family in difficult times, but it’s been starved of money, and hurt by years of creeping privatisation.

leaflet.personalStatement: I was born and brought up here in the Calder Valley, and I live here in the constituency with my wife and daughter.

politicalExperience.role: Worked for Oxfam, Child Poverty Action Group, and TUC

contactInformation.address: Calder Valley Labour Office, Trades Club Building, Holme Street, Hebden Bridge, HX7 8EE

images.caption: Vote Josh Fenton-Glynn, Standing to be your Labour MP

examples: The NHS has been there for my family in difficult times, but it’s been starved of money, and hurt by years of creeping privatisation.
We need more jobs that are not increasingly casual, precarious work that undermines our dignity, and makes our lives uncertain.
Anyone hit by the floods knows the importance of this. We only have one planet, and we have to protect it. My daughter’s generation is relying on us.
Some of the trains on the Calder Valley line are as old as I am. We need long-term planning for northern railways.
We need proper regional infrastructure development in Calderdale and in Yorkshire. We have a real opportunity to create 'green' jobs and jobs in high-tech manufacturing.
I was born and brought up here in the Calder Valley, and I live here in the constituency with my wife and daughter.
I have spent many years working for Oxfam, the Child Poverty Action Group and the TUC.
Some of the trains on the Calder Valley line are as old as I am.
We need long-term planning for northern railways.
We need proper regional infrastructure development in Calderdale and in Yorkshire.
The NHS has been there for my family in difficult times, but it’s been starved of money, and hurt by years of creeping privatisation.
Anyone hit by the floods knows the importance of this. We only have one planet, and we have to protect it. My daughter’s generation is relying on us.
